result.execSummary:
The defendant Ralph C. Vickers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ralph C. Vickers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $1158.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frank Parise.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes a fine of $500 + costs, 30 days to pay, or civil judgment to be entered.

ADA Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE in person with Attorney Frank Parise. Clerk R. Matoska-Mentink
DE needs further time to review offer and determine whether to proceed to trial.

Per email from Atty Parise, case is resolved.  Plea 11/30/15 at 8:30.
And demand for discovery - filed by AA M Graveley.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Ralph C. Vickers, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time.  Parties are instructed to submit a letter or email regarding their status for trial in place of a jury status hearing.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Ralph C. Vickers, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
